Key Match Events: Victor Wembanyama delivered one big play after another, from driving the offense to blocking key shots down the stretch.
The Spurs exploited transition mismatches whenever possible, allowing Wembanyama to isolate against smaller defenders or find open teammates on the perimeter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rockets counted on Alperen Sengun's physical presence and Jabari Smith Jr.'s versatility to disrupt the Spurs' inside-out game plan.
Post-Match Reflections: With Wembanyama leading a talented young core, the Spurs may not just be rebuilding—they might be ready to compete sooner than expected.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The home crowd couldn’t get enough, chanting “MVP” as Wembanyama delivered one big play after another.
Wembanyama was everywhere the Spurs needed him to be, shooting a sharp 10-of-17 from the field and adding seven rebounds and three blocks.
Others: The Rockets positioned Sengun in the post to contest Wembanyama’s interior play, betting on his strength and size to force tougher shots.
Sengun struggled to adjust to Wembanyama’s length and shooting range, making it difficult to fully contest shots without fouling or conceding open looks.
